clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Profile of SYL1801 Eye Drops
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Profile of Different Doses of SYL1801 Ophthalmic Solution in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Study of the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic profile of different doses of SYL1801 eye drops in healthy volunteers.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Interventional, observer-masked, parallel groups, time-lagged trial to study safety, tolerability and PK of SYL1801 sodium in healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Ocular tolerability at the site of administration (cornea and conjunctiva) after last instillation of the assigned dose level (1 day of treatment).
Ocular tolerability at the site of administration (cornea and conjunctiva) after last instillation of the assigned dose level (7 days of treatment).
Determination of the maximum Plasma Concentration [Cmax]
primary_outcome.time_frame: - 15 - 30 minutes, 1- 4 and 24 hours after last administration

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of the Area Under the Curve of plasma concentrations until the last extraction time [AUT 0-t]
primary_outcome.time_frame: - 15 - 30 minutes, 1- 4 and 24 hours after last administration

clinical_study.condition: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Profile in Healthy Volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Body mass index (BMI) between 19.5 and 29.0 kg/m2
- Intraocular pressure (IOP) <=21 mmHg
- Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) >= 70 ETDRS
- Normal corneal and conjunctival assessment
- Normal funduscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding females or those with a positive pregnancy test. Females of childbearing potential who will not use a medically acceptable contraceptive method
- Current relevant diseases according to the investigator's judgement.
- Previous relevant chronic processes according to the investigator's judgement
- Relevant visual alterations according to the investigator's judgement
- Administration of systemic medications
- Case history of hypersensitivity to medicinal products or any other allergic process
- Participation in any clinical study with an investigational drug/device within 3 months prior to the first day of dosing.
